intro: Swartzia zeledonensis, commonly known as the Zeledón swartzia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Leguminosae. It is native to the tropical regions of Central America, particularly Costa Rica and Panama. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. It produces woody pods that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind or animals. Swartzia zeledonensis is often found in moist, shaded environments within lowland forests.
